channel.title: Need Help Hosting
channel.description:
I have a Westell 327W and used [url=http://www.portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/Westell/Versalink327W/XBConnect.htm]this[/url] link and followed all the directions exactly except I changed the ports in the tutorial to 43594 but people still can't join. Do you have to restart your computer or your router? I allowed the port in Windows Firewall but I also have Bsafe Online v4.5 and Zone Alarm Pro and I was wondering if there are messing me up? Also, how do I test if my server is joinable or not?
TestScape Thanks, -Ryu[br][size=1]Posted at: September 20, 2006, 04:21:47 PM[/size][hr]UPDATE: I added my server to the Server Status Page and it says that it is online which means my ports are forwarded. The only problem is when my friend pings me it doesn't work and no one can join. Do I have to restart my computer or something?[br][size=1]Posted at: September 20, 2006, 05:03:37 PM[/size][hr]Update: Now my server is offline on the list. Someone please explain :confused:[br][size=1]Posted at: September 20, 2006, 05:33:28 PM[/size][hr]UPDATE: Now I realized how to get your server to show up. You need to run No-IP DUC and compile, run and log into yourserver.
My friends still can't connect and I forwarded my ports. Could my firewalls be preventing them?

item.title: Need Help Hosting
item.dc:creator: @squirlanator squirlanator

@squirlanator wrote:

thx r u online rite now?

item.title: Need Help Hosting

item.description:

[quote=“xRYUx, post:1, topic:15528”]I have a Westell 327W and used this link and followed all the directions exactly except I changed the ports in the tutorial to 43594 but people still can’t join. Do you have to restart your computer or your router? I allowed the port in Windows Firewall but I also have Bsafe Online v4.5 and Zone Alarm Pro and I was wondering if there are messing me up? Also, how do I test if my server is joinable or not?

TestScape
Thanks,
-Ryu[br][size=1]Posted at: September 20, 2006, 04:21:47 PM[/size][hr]UPDATE: I added my server to the Server Status Page and it says that it is online which means my ports are forwarded. The only problem is when my friend pings me it doesn’t work and no one can join. Do I have to restart my computer or something?[br][size=1]Posted at: September 20, 2006, 05:03:37 PM[/size][hr]Update: Now my server is offline on the list. Someone please explain [br][size=1]Posted at: September 20, 2006, 05:33:28 PM[/size][hr]UPDATE: Now I realized how to get your server to show up. You need to run No-IP DUC and compile, run and log into yourserver.

My friends still can’t connect and I forwarded my ports. Could my firewalls be preventing them?[/quote]
neat can u tell me ur ip?

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help Hosting
item.dc:creator: @xRYUx xRYUx
item.description:
@xRYUx wrote:

On another topic

[quote]My friends still can’t connect and I forwarded my ports. Could my firewalls be preventing them?

your friends are probably idiots[/quote]

No, they know how to connect to servers -.- When they ping me it comes up as —. Why can’t anyone join, can someone try joining my server right now? It’s xpcscape.no-ip.org, tell me if you can join please.[br][size=1]Posted at: September 20, 2006, 06:05:39 PM[/size][hr]Hey everyone it works!!!

Read full topic
